text: welcome to the aws bug bust re invent
challenge
i will help you get started with the bug
bust reinvent challenge in this demo
first click the sign in button on the
bugbus.aws
webpage
you'll see the aws bugbus login dialog
in the entry field that appears
type the email address that you use for
github
then type a password
and click the create your account button
at the top of the page you'll see a
notification that you need to verify
your email address
and a confirmation that a code has been
sent to your email
now
enter the code that was sent to your
email
and click the verify the code button
after you type the correct code you'll
see a notification that your account was
created successfully
this will take you to the dashboard
where you can review your authorized
email address
ensuring it is the same one you use for
github
accept the terms and conditions of the
challenge
and then click the accept github
invitation button
this will take you to the challenge
dashboard with the events
click one of the view event bugs buttons
to go to the dashboard for that event
this is a test event i've created
click on the bugs tab
and scroll down the page
and click all bugs to see all of the
available bugs
you can review all of the available bugs
that need to be fixed
and then click the claim button to claim
a bug that you want to fix in the
challenge
you can claim up to five bugs at a time
and each claim lasts for five hours
if the bug is not fixed within five
hours it goes back to the pool and
someone else can claim it
now you can view the details of your bug
and you'll see a confirmation that
you've claimed this bug successfully
there are a couple of links in the bug
details i want to point out
the first link goes to the description
of the details of the problem in the
recommended fix
you can open that in a new tab
and the next link goes to the repository
where the source code is on github
you'll receive an email invitation from
github to join the organization for
access to this code so you can fork the
repository
be sure
to go into your email settings in github
and uncheck the keep my email addresses
private box
if you don't do this you will not be
awarded points
now when you're ready to make your code
changes to fix the bug
you must write it to a branch so that
you can raise the pull request on the
original parent repository
of course you can do this on the command
line with git commands i'm just using
the github interface for this
demonstration
so you'll write your code changes to a
branch
and then add a description for your
commit
and click the create pull request button
there we go
and now
i can go back to the aws bugbus
challenge dashboard
and if i select my pull request
i can see the details of the pull
request that i made on the code
repository
and there we go find out if i fixed it
the status says
no fixed detected so i haven't fixed
this bug yet but that's okay
i can go back and make another pull
request and try to fix it for up to five
hours
and once i do fix the bug i will be
awarded the points for that bug on the
my achievements page
and the more points that i'm awarded
the higher i will appear on the
leaderboard
as a top bug buster
